alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 12 at 2:21AM PDT until June 15 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington...Oregon... Columbia River at Vancouver affecting Greater Vancouver Area and Greater Portland Metro Area zones. Columbia River at Longview affecting Lower Columbia and I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County zones. .Periods of heavy rain over the past 48 hours combined with melting snowpack in the mountains has resulted in rising river levels along the Columbia River. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Columbia River at Vancouver. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 16.0 feet, expect flooding of some islands and low areas, with minor impacts for parks and trails along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The stage was 15.2 ft early Sunday morning. - Forecast...The river is forecast to approach minor flood stage of 16 feet Monday or Tuesday. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
